Text: I watch the trailer and can't help but smile when I found it already on my e-bookshelf. I thought I would cry a river when I read this book, but not really. Bagian yang paling bikin sedih buat saya hanya bagian terakhir ketika akhirnya Lou menemui Will di Swiss. But, I like it, for the whole story. And I really would miss Will. Ini pasti salahnya Sam Claflin, kenapa dia ganteng banget. :P

Karena saya menonton lebih dulu daripada membaca novelnya, I can imagine the whole story of this novel because at first time I really couldn't figure out anything. The opening of this novel really made me go crazy. *forgive me cause I'm bad in english. Dan, yah, karena belum selesai, I can't say about the ending. But in its film, Emma Morley was dead, it's kinda disappointing me. :( wait me till I finish it!! --------------------------------------------------------------------- Dexter is really kind of annoying playboy! why he had to do thatttttt??? you won't understand what I mean by "that". oh okay, I got boring with this all stuffs and just finish it without any attention in it. i don't get it. i'm too lazy to read something in english right nowwww. tapi, setidaknya saya menangkap inti cerita dari filmnya. oh okay, harus aku akui bahwa filmnya bener2 baguuuuussssss bangetttt. I got the feeling. apalagi chemistry between Em and Dex. tapi entah jadi males mo baca pdf iniii. :(( entah sama atau ga dengan filmnya yang pasti ada beberapa perbedaan. and I'm impressed dari Dex yang mau bangkit dari keterpurukan setelah tahu bahwa semua orang mencintainya. soalnya dia itu bener2 kayak orang yang mau ikutan mati sama Emma pas Emma died.

BEIDZOT kāds romāns, kurā galvenie varoņi nav ideāli un teju nedabiski skaisti. Nav arī salkanību par mīlestību no pirmā acu skatiena. Varoņi un notikumi veidoti tieši tā, lai varētu tiem noticēt un gribētos just līdzi.

Deivida Nikolsa grāmata "Viena Diena" ir ļoti aizkustinošs mīlas stāsts par Emmu un Deksteru, kas pirmo reizi satikās savā izlaiduma ballē. Tomēr viņi kļūst par labiem draugiem, bet dzīve katram ir lēmusi savu ceļu. Emma ir mierīga un ļoti nosvērta, domā par savu nākotni, tomēr Deksters ir dzīves baudītājs, viņš daudz ceļo un ir vieglprātīgs. Abi varoņi ir ļoti dažādi, tieši tādēļ arī ir tik labi draugi, viņi viens otru papildina. Kaut arī ikdienā abi neredz viens otru, katru gadu, vienā un tajā pašā datumā , 15. jūlijā, abi cenšas satikties. Laika gaitā abiem izveidojas jūtas vienam pret otru, kaut arī katram jau ir sava dzēve, ģimene. Tomēr liktenis viņiem bija lēmis būt kopā, viņi aprecas. Grāmata ir ļoti aizraujoša un ir grūti paredzēt tās daudzveidīgos notikumus,kā piemēram beigu traģēdiju, kad Emma nomira, tieši tādēļ man tā tik ļoti patika. Tā noteikti māca izbaudīt dzīvi un neaizmirst savu būtību. Šis stāsts man tik ļoti patika, jo bija ļoti romantisks un bija parādītas daudzveidīgās cilvēku būtības, problēmas ar kurām cilvēki mēdz saskarties. Kā arī ļoti interesanti likās, ka darbība bija sadalīta gados. Noteikti ieteiktu izlasīt šo grāmatu, ja gribi izjust dažādas sajūtas, tev patīk romantika.

I like romance, but not traditional, cookie cutter romance novels. A twist on “Same Time Next Year”, this novel takes us into the lives of Dex and Emma on July 11, 1988, their graduation day, and then every year after on the same date. Some years they are together; others, not. This is wonderfully written, without cliches, or predictable tropes—and it surprised me over and over. And the ending? Breathtaking. Highly recommend
[ITU EMMA KENAPA TIBA-TIBA DIBUAT MATI? GAK ADA HUJAN, GAK ADA ANGIN, BALIK KE BAB BARU, DIA MATI. DAN IYA, SAYA SANGAT GAK NYANTE SAMPAI PAKAI HURUF BESAR SEMUA. (hide spoiler) ]
Jättegott men lite konstigt att läsa på svenska.

tidak semenggugah my sister's keeper, tapi tetap menyentuh. dan yang ini enak dibaca, flow-nya mengalir :) ceritanya tetap seputar kemelut dalam keluarga, kali ini mengangkat soal dua saudara laki-laki, yang sulung menderita Asperger's dan yang bungsu normal. yang paling menyentuh adalah bagaimana usaha si sulung dalam berusaha mencintai keluarganya dengan cara dia sendiri, dan bagaimana si bungsu berusaha mengerti bahwa dia akan lebih "tidak dicintai" oleh orangtuanya karena kakaknya memerlukan perhatian lebih a sweet touching story (but still with a case of death person in it)
It's a not so bad book, if u are looking for a book wd stupid boy and a very stupid girl u found it!!
So predictable but so perfect!
A pesar de ser una historia común; me entretuve mucho. Lectura liviana para reirse harto.
makasih buat ping yang udah rekomen <3 suka suka suka.... suka temanya, couplenya, chemistrynya, konfliknya, endingnya , deabakk !!! penasaran sama buku yg kedua , adiknya nick sama count itali itu
Dosyć melodramatyczne (kiczowate). Słodkie aż zęby bola a bohaterka dość naiwna.
Uma leitura agradável e divertida! A pleasurable and funny read!

“Zar vam nikad nije palo na pamet da je život samo niz filmova?” Pat Peoples je glavni lik ovog romana. Upravo je izašao iz bolnice gdje je završio zbog psihičkih poremećaja. Nakon traume, koje se ne sjeća, jedini mu je cilj da vrati svoju ženu Nikki od koje je razdvojen, te svaki dan podređuje tome. Nikki je htjela da bude bolji čovjek. Htjela je da smršavi. Da pročita klasične romane, kako bi sudjelovao u intelektualnim raspravama. Pa tako Pat provodi dane mahnito vježbajući, čitajući, trudi se biti ljubazan prema apsolutno svima te ljude neprestano podsjeća kako će mu se Nikki uskoro vratiti, samo kad bi ga vidjela ovakvog – sada je potpuno drugačiji čovjek. Time izluđuje svoju obitelj, pogotovo jadnu majku koja pati zbog njegova stanja, jer nitko mu ne može objasniti da se Nikki neće vratiti – on to jednostavno nije u stanju prihvatiti i smatra da svi lažu. Da stvar bude gora, misli da su razdvojeni tjednima, eventualno mjesecima… No, prošle su godine. Pat nema 30 godina kako vjeruje, već 34. Uvjeren je da je njegov život film koji producira Bog osobno. Ovo je priča o čovjeku sa ozbiljnim problemima te je prikazan način kako on razmišlja, ali i utjecaj njegove bolesti na okolinu, tj.najbliže. Uskoro ga prijatelji spajaju s Tiffany, mladom udovicom koja također posjećuje psihijatra i koja ga u velikoj mjeri razumije i želi mu pomoći, no Pat je uvjeren kako je ona u potpunosti luda. Sve to zajedno dovodi do niza tragikomičnih situacija – u jednom se momentu nasmijete, a u sljedećem imate grižnju savjesti, jer čovjeku očito nije dobro. No, u tome i leži šarm ove knjige. “Izgleda drugačije od svih ljudi koje poznajem – ne može napraviti sretan izraz lica kakav drugi ljudi namještaju kada znaju da ih netko gleda. Ne stavlja to lice za mene, zbog čega joj nekako vjerujem.” Teško je odrediti žanr ove knjige. Definitivno je realistična fikcija, tema je bliska onome s čime se mnogi ljudi svakog dana susreću. Ujedno je i prava životna drama s dobro odmjerenom dozom humora – dovoljno da ne bude neukusno, a opet “podiže” knjigu te općenito sumornu temu čini lakom za čitanje i prihvaćanje. “Morate shvatiti da želje nisu dovoljne, samo vas djela mogu učiniti boljim čovjekom.” Kroz svakodnevne zanimljive događaje koji prate Pata također otkrivamo djeliće prošlosti, sve do trena kada se on može prisjetiti svega i suočiti se s učinjenim i realnošću. Zaključci do kojih dolazi dragocjeni su dio ove interesantne knjige. Iako svjestan da je teško bolestan, čak se i šali račun toga, Pat je lik kojeg ćete zavoljeti. Pričajući svoju priču, brutalno je iskren, a njegova je doza optimizma ogromna (i upravo je to krivac zašto ga ne smatraju zdravim, toliko se nada da živi u iluzijama) da je to jednostavno zarazno. Također je borac, vjeruje u naporan rad i upornost, te posjeduje mnoge vrline, a prije svega je dobroćudan što ga čini simpatičnim. Ostali su likovi iz knjige također realni, a njihovo nošenje sa situacijom opisuje Pat kroz svoje viđenje, što je zbilja dobrodošla i zanimljiva perspektiva. Uistinu nisam znala što očekivati od ove knjige, ali kratak sadržaj me zainteresirao dovoljno da krenem s čitanjem. Drago mi je da vam je mogu preporučiti pa ako vas je knjiga zaintrigirala, ne oklijevajte. Možda Pat ima nekakvu poruku upravo za vas! https://www.facebook.com/210901922419...
Nunca esperé que me gustara. Tiene miniserie escrito por todos lados.

Sebagai fans berat seri Harry Potter, saya sangat menunggu-nunggu momen bisa membaca buku J.K. Rowling selanjutnya setelah beberapa tahun menunda. Mungkin ada rasa masih terlarut dengan kisah Hary Potter jadi belum punya niatan untuk membaca seri lain dari penulis yang sama. Dan pada akhirnya sampailah saya membaca buku The Casual Vacancy ini. Saya suka ide ceritanya, tapi bukan penggemar endingnya :") Tapi setelah membaca buku ini, saya 'merasa' semakin memahami gaya penulisan J.K. Rowling, yang deskriptif tapi tidak kelewat mendetail sehingga masih dapat dinikmati dengan baik (karena sejujurnya saya bukan penyuka tulisan deskripsi mendetail), yang mengingatkan saya akan harry Potter dan kenapa saya sangat menikmati membacanya. Overall, a nice book dan jadi penasaran dengan adaptasi ke serial TV-nya. Sepertinya serial TV dengan ide cerita The Casual Vacancy ini akan seru (?)

Lo primero que hice al terminar Tan Fuerte, Tan Cerca de Jonathan Safran Foer fue ir a Goodreads para ver si alguien más pensaba como yo respecto a este libro. Descubrí que la mayoría de las reseñas no sólo son positivas, sino que son reseñas de 5 estrellas. Y yo acá dándole 1 estrella a este libro que tuve que leer para una clase de Literatura... Vi que algunxs en Goodreads sí lo catalogaron como que debería llamarse "Tan Artificial, Tan Insoportable" o "Tan Pretencioso, Tan Irritante" xD. Ay, ay, ay... “Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living.” Me puse en los zapatos de un niño de 9 años antes de empezar a leer este libro, entendiendo que esto iba a ser un Middle Grade . ¿Qué encontré en cambio? Encontré a un autor que hace uso de su narrador como le da la gana, volviéndolo poco acorde a la edad, difícil de conectar y sin duda sin un lenguaje correspondiente a sus 9 años. Cuando Jonathan Safran Foer tenía algo profundo para decir, sus palabras no coincidían con el resto de la narración del protagonista de 9 años. Este fue un libro que para mí no tuvo voz propia, sino que tuvo la voz que el escritor quería de acuerdo a sus propios antojos. La trama, la construcción de personajes, lo superficial que era todo... Siempre intento ser respetuosa incluso con los libros que no disfruto, pero Tan Fuerte, Tan Cerca me gana. Espero que me disculpen xD. Simplemente no quiero no explayarme con lo enojada que estoy con esta lectura xD. PERDÓOOOONNNNN. “Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.”

“Succotash my ballzac, dipshiitake,” says 9-year-old Oskar Schell in Jonathan Safran Foer’s Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close. He is a strange and misunderstood boy who longs for a greater knowledge and purpose than the basic lessons he is taught at school. The book follows Oskar’s journey to find the lock belonging to the mysterious key his beloved father left him before he was killed in 9-11. Oskar feels alone without his dad but during his quest he meets all kinds of people that bring him joy and teach him lessons. The book also includes the story of Oskar’s grandparents, made up of letters from his grandmother to him about her relationship with his grandfather and letters from Oskar’s grandfather to his dad about why he left. The theme of not having to know everything to be happy is probably the best component. The book is chock-full of tiny insignificant details, like Oskar’s dad circling words in the paper and the pages dedicated to people writing things in colored markers. When Oskar, who wants to know everything, finally accepts that he can’t learn everything there is to know in the world and becomes satisfied. In doing this, the reader is forced to accept that they will never know the significance of every little detail in the book. Jonathan Safran Foer also does a good job of creating Oskar’s point-of-view so that it actually reflects his immediate thoughts. One of the problems with the book is it gets so caught up in creating the strangest, most non-human characters with the most unrealistic stories that it strays away from the story it is actually trying to tell. At first, the book is entertaining and interesting, but Oskar’s bizarre thoughts take up so much space in the book that it is hard to know what is actually going on. In addition, the main characters are bad people. Oskar shuts out all support his family tries to provide, his grandma lies to their whole family about the identity of her renter, and his grandpa leaves his wife to raise a child alone. Protagonists don’t always have to be purely good but it is hard to read a three-hundred-page book with no attachment or devotion to the main characters. Conclusively, the book has a decent premise but it ultimately fails to execute it in an adequate story.

buku yang aneeh! able to hit u with deep heavy thoughts about life. darn! bukuyang mendung it is! gives u hope at the same time sends arrays of bitterness! T_________T memikat, menharu biru, kreatif, dramatis dan orisinil, tragis jenaka dan menyentuh.. ---nda bohong tawwa reviewernya! :) (tapi, nda ji lah sampai seperti ala ala reviewnya baltimore sun...haha) still wonder if oskar might be slightly autistic?? hhaha, or maybe he's just simply a precocious old soul... grandpa and grandma Schell, they could be happier..they should be!!!!!!!! hyaah~~~ keluarga yang aneh!
Brilliant. Moving. Definitely a mood killer, but worth it.
meski dibaca dalam rentang waktu yang sangat lama (berbulan-bulan!), lupa berbagai detil, tapi setiap kali membacanya saya jatuh cinta kepada rangkaian kata-kata dalam buku ini :')
Kept me awake at night. It's a suspenseful read, but a bit creepy for my tastes. It didn't help that I read it when Elizabeth Smart was missing.

Sebenernya tidak terlalu tertarik dengan buku-buku dengan tema pembunuhan seperti ini, soalnya jatuh-jatuhnya jadi takut dan sebel. Berhubung ada filmnya, jadi penasaran pengen baca sebelum nonton filmnya. Susie Salmon, diperkosa dan tewas di tangan tetangganya yang aneh Mr Harvey. Seperti yang diduga sebelumnya, adegan perkosaan ini salah satu yang aku ngga suka tapi terpaksa baca. Susie yang meninggal ternayata masih nyangkut di alam antara, antara alam baka dan dunia. Susie jga masih suka mengunjungi keluarganya, melihat situasi dan perubahan yang terjadi setelah dia tiada. Kesedihan dan frustasi akibat kehilangan Susie sangat terasa, penulis mampu melukiskan kemurungan dan kesedihan yang dialami keluarga Susie. Walaupun akhirnya cukup mengecewakan, aku sih maunya pelaku ditangkap dan dihukum. Sayang, keberuntungan mengikuti pelaku sehingga dapat mati tanpa merasakan hukuman. Filmnya juga bagus.
Perlu waktu lama buat menyelesaikan novel ini. Mungkin karena banyaknya sudut pandang yang diambil. Belum lagi aku juga terlanjur nonton versi filmnya jadinya bacanya banyak dicepetin.

This review is available in English at CommunityBookStop . Kitaptan filme geçmeyen, geçemeyen yerler olsa da Cate Blanchett ile hayat bulan Bernadette'e bayıldım. Yorum, film de eklenerek güncellendi: https://zimlicious.com/yorum-neredesi...

Don Tillman Don is a quirky scientist “geek” who has traits that could put him on the autism spectrum. He uses his sense of humor to deal with his social anxieties when dealing with strangers and he wants to find a wife. Rosie is a psychology student who works as a bar maid and she wants to find her biological Dad. Two unlikely people form a friendship and following their story was so enjoyable!

The book “The Rosie Project” by Graeme Simsion came to my attention when I read that Melinda Gates gave it to her husband Bill Gates to read. This is a light “romantic comedy” story that I enjoyed a lot. Professor Don Tillman who is a bit constrained socially by his Asperger's starts the search for a wife. It all starts with a questionnaire to weed out “the drinkers, the smokers, the vegans, the late arrivers,…” But of course the way romance works, into his life comes Rosie Jarman, who doesn’t pass muster if one follows the rules of the questionnaire. But of course, love never works as easily as a formula would make it. Many compare the character of professor Tillman to Dr Sheldon Cooper from The Big Bang Theory. It is appropriate to do so, and if you don’t see the humor and charm in Sheldon, you won’t find it in this book. But if you do, I think you’ll enjoy this story of two people finding each other and as any good story of love shows, they not only find each other, but also find themselves. The author did pen a sequel "The Rosie Effect" that I will be picking up. I enjoyed the characters so much, I want to follow their lives a bit more.
Good beginning, good ASD portrayal, ho-hum finish.

Ihan viihdyttävä kirja, johon menetin mielenkiintoni loppua kohden. Herää kysymys, että mitä mieltä autismin kirjon ihmiset tästä ovat. Ainakin yhden löytämäni arvion mukaan tämä on erittäin huono kuvaus Aspergerin oireyhtymästä.

Oddychové letné čítanie, ktorého téma sa dá zhrnúť ako "Sheldon si hľadá manželku". V zásade príbeh lásky, ale napísaný celkom vtipne a nie pateticky. Čítalo sa to samo a čo považujem za veľké plus, nemala som na každej strane chuť dať postavám facku - čo je v tomto žánri celkom vzácne. V rámci kategórie "oddych na leto" celkom odporúčam.
A lighthearted fun read. An Australian version of the 'Big Bang theory "

// In Swedish: Riktigt trevlig bok för alla er som gillade "Curious incident of the dog in the nighttime" =) eller karaktären Sheldon Cooper ^^ Rolig och söta karaktärer! Rekommenderas starkt! Finns översatt på svenska nu med ;) // In English: Really funny and cute story with great characters, highly recommends!
Heel erg leuk boek! Ontzettend grappig en enorm lief.

Tipikal Nicholas Sparks, kisah tentang cinta dan kesetiaan yang lumayan mengharu biru. Kadang-kadang saya mikir, tema yang Om Sparks tulis itu-itu saja dan cenderung lebay. Tapi okelah, mari kita nikmati, secara saya suka yang romantis-romantis. Travis Parker, pria lajang yang prospek banget (pengen dong yang kayak gini :p) jatuh cinta pada tetangga barunya, Gabby Holland, yang awalnya menuduh Moby, anjing Travis telah menghamili Molly, anjing Gabby. Sejak itu hubungan mereka makin dekat. Hingga akhirnya mereka menikah, memiliki anak, dan... terjadilah peristiwa itu, yang mengubah hidup mereka... * Suka dengan penokohan Travis yang cuek dan apa adanya, tapi kurang suka dengan penokohan Gabby. Suka dengan persahabatan Travis dengan 3 teman (dan keluarganya). Suka dengan hubungan Travis dengan adiknya Stephanie. Ehm, mungkin karena itu penokohan Gabby jadi kurang dieksplor ya, karena memang lebih fokus ke Travis. Intinya novel ini lumayan lah, agak dekat dengan A Walk to Remember (yang bikin saya menangis di bus). Baru menjelang ending saya ngeh kenapa novel ini diberi judul "The Choice".

Travis Parker, seorang dokter hewan, petualang, pintar memasak, dan..... mencintai Gabby Holland. Tak heran pada akhirnya Gabby, seorang asisten dokter, penyayang hewan.... juga mencintai Travis. Padahal ia sudah memiliki kekasih, Kevin. Tapi, 'The Choice' yang dimaksud dalam judul, ternyata bukan pilihan antara Travis dan Kevin utk Gabby. Semua di mulai setelah akhirnya Travis dan Gabby menikah, memiliki anak dua, dan kehidupan rumah tangga yang begitu harmonis~ Suatu ketika, Travis dan Gabby mengalami kecelakaan. Hal itu membuat Gabby tak sadarkan diri untuk waktu yang sangat lama..... Hingga di bulan ketiga, Gabby masih tak sadarkan diri. Gabby pernah bercerita kepada Travis, kemungkinan seseorang untuk bangun dari koma adalah sebelum enam minggu. Namun, Gabby masih tak sadarkan diri. Hingga 12 bulan. Dan lebih. Travis, semakin lama semakin terlihat kurus. Dan, ia mempunyai pilihan: Akan kan ia mempertahankan Gabby, atau merelakannya? Ini buku kedua Sparks yang aku baca, dan aku masih suka dengan apa yang ditulisnya. Hmmm... ya, Sparks memang begitu. Dicintai oleh penggemarnya karena mampu menyajikan kisah romantis dengan cara yang oke banget. Alur maju mundur cerita membuat kisah ini seru, layaknya menyusun puzzle, membaca dan terus membaca untuk menemukan puzzle yang hilang. Memang sih, kisah cinta yang ditampilkan sangat utopia. Saling jatuh cinta dalam waktu hanya beberapa hari. Kalau utk logika ini, A Walk to Remember jauh lebih baik. Namun, terlepas dari itu buatku Sparks mampu menyampaikannya dengan sangat baiiiik. Aku sampai membayangkan kasih sayang Travis kepada Gabby yang begitu besar, dan koneksi diantara keduanya. Bahkan, Stephanie, adik Travis diam-diam mengagumi dan terinspirasi dengan hubungan mereka berdua: ia tidak ingin menikah sebelum menemukan yang pas seperti hanya Travis dan Gabby. Stephanie, tokoh yang paling aku suka dalam buku ini. Stephanie merupakan sosok yang terlihat cuek, namun sebetulnya peka, bahkan punya rasa empati yang cukup dalam, sehingga ia sering dikira mampu bercenayang. Selain itu, dia juga cerdas dan blak-blakan. Di awal cerita, Stephanie muncul sebagai sosok yang seakan-akan sudah mengetahui bahwa Travis dan Gabby akan menjadi seorang teman setelah perkenalan mereka (karena insiden). Lalu, berlanjut ketika Stephanie berkenalan dengan Gabby dan berbincang layaknya seperti teman lama. Dan, Stephanie juga muncul untuk menyemangati, mendukung dan membantu Travis dalam keadaan apapun. Meskipun kemunculannya jarang, tapi kehadiran Stephanie memberikan warna lebih, sehingga tidak hanya kisah cinta antar Travis dan Gabby saja yang muncul, tetapi juga antar keluarga (Travis dan Stephanie) dan antar sahabat (Travis dan Gabby). Poin plus lainnya buat Sparks. Secara keseluruhan, buku ini sangat seru! Ditambah dengan nilai-nilai kehidupannya, baik yang tersirat maupun tersurat..... Keep going on, Sparks!

Dalam The Choice, Nicholas Sparks mengalirkan kisah percintaan yang indah antara Travis Parker dan Gabby Holland. Travis dengan kehidupan lajangnya yang menarik, ditemani oleh teman-teman dekat dan keluarganya; Gabby dengan kehidupan percintaannya yang monoton, menunggu ajakan menikah dari kekasihnya. Travis dengan usahanya mencari pasangan, Gabby dengan usahanya utk meyakinkan dirinya sendiri bahwa hidupnya telah sesuai dengan harapannya selama ini. Travis dengan segala pesonanya, dan Gabby dengan segala sifatnya yang alami. Dan mereka memang saling jatuh cinta. Travis menemukan apa yang selama ini dicarinya, Gabby menyadari kekosongan hidupnya. 11 tahun kemudian, setelah membentuk keluarga yang bahagia dengan 2 anak perempuan, keluarga mereka dihadapkan pada kenyataan menyakitkan yang memisahkan Travis dan Gabby dan kemungkinan kacaunya kehidupan kedua anak mereka. Travis dihadapkan pada pilihan sulit, apakah ia akan melepaskan Gabby, seperti apa yang diharapkan oleh Gabby bila mereka dihadapkan pada pilihan itu, atau tetap mempertahankannya? “How far should you go in the name of love?”, pertanyaan itu terus diajukan Travis pada dirinya sendiri dan pada adik yang dipercayanya bisa menjawabkan untuknya. Tapi itu adalah pertanyaan yang harus dijawab sendiri oleh Travis, atau oleh kita bila kita yang diharuskan utk menghadapi kenyataan itu. Tapi Travis bisa menghadapinya. Dia membuat semua orang bisa melihat, bahwa mungkin cinta sejati memang ada; bahwa masa-masa sulit sekalipun tidak akan membuat cinta sejadi hilang; dan bahwa mungkin cinta akan membantu kita utk memilih satu dari 2 pilihan sulit meskipun cinta tidak akan membuat kita melihat apa yang akan terjadi selanjutnya…
2 much narasi..muter2 disitu aja. ga konsisten aja watakx. epilog aja sih yg lmyn bikin deg2an nunggu gabby bangun/ga.. Mr.sparks sll jago deskripsi latar blakang.tmpt tgl&suasana

I picked up “The Choice” by Nicholas Sparks because I knew the movie was coming out soon and I must read the book before I see the movie. And really, if there is one thing that Nicholas Sparks is good at, it’s making you really upset with love. And so I dug into the story of Travis and Gabby in order to find out what choice needs to be made and by whom. But that is not something I am going to give away, you’ll have to learn that on your own. Gabby was a pretty funny character and I found myself relating to her a lot. Her determination when she thinks she is right, her strong beliefs, her parents – there were quite a few similarities. “But she couldn’t deny that family was important to her. That’s the thing about being the product of happily married parents. You grow up thinking the fairy tale is real, and more than that, you think you’re entitled to live it. So far, though, it wasn’t working out as planned.” (The Choice, pg 35). This quote really spoke to me; I’ve definitely been there. I was a little ruined as a kid having grown up with my parents that are super in love, and having watched as much Disney as I do – I really did believe that the fairy tale was a given. I certainly had to kiss my fair share of frogs before finding my own prince. I liked that Gabby had that uncertainty in her life and although she wasn’t unhappy with her life, she knew there was something missing. Gabby’s solid attitude is part of what throws her off so much when she meets Travis. She very quickly learns that he is carefree almost to a fault, which is so different from her own demeanor. Having lived her life so safely, Gabby was captivated when learning about all the places that Travis has traveled. “But I’m different now than I was then. Just like I was different at the end of the trip than I’d been at the beginning. And I’ll be different tomorrow than I am today. And what that means is that I can never replicate the trip. Even if I went to the same places and met the same people, it wouldn’t be the same. My experience wouldn’t be the same. To me, that’s what traveling should be about. Meeting people, learning to not only appreciate a different culture, but really enjoy it like a local, following whatever impulse strikes you.” (The Choice, pg 102). I liked this quote because I think it gives some insight into Travis as a character. The way that he explains traveling around is so similar to how he behaves day to day. He spends his time really living as much as he can. He travels, he does extreme activities, and really, he does whatever he wants to. That is the carefree attitude that he has, which is part of what Gabby finds so frustrating and refreshing at the same time. It isn’t as simple as falling in love for them, which is part of what made this a good read. Would I recommend this book? Yes, but not to everyone. It certainly was not Nicholas Spark’s best work. There were plenty of sappy moments as only Nicholas Sparks can write. It was captivating enough that I continually felt drawn to the book until it was over. And yes, I cried. Nicholas Sparks is a jerk and I should know better.

Suzie Croxall Ms. Elison Term One Book Review In my book “The Choice” Gaby moves into a new neighborhood to be closer to her boyfriend. But her boyfriend goes on a work trip for the week, and Gaby meets her attractive neighbor. After about a day of moving in Gaby already can’t stand her neighbor, and they get annoyed with each other. But eventually start getting to really know each other and hanging out. While her boyfriend is still on his trip Gaby and her neighbor Travis start falling for each other, and when her boyfriend gets back, she dumps him, and she gets married to Travis. I Really liked this book; it was interesting and fun to read. I really liked how the author wrote the book, it was easy and fluent to read. I also really liked it because it wasn’t predictable, but it was also very realistic. I can compare it to real life because many people judge others before they actually get to know the real person. But I think most people would like others more if they didn’t judge “a book by it’s cover”. I would rate this book a 4.75, because I loved it but, there were a few parts I had to skip because they where inappropriate.
It was definitely slow in getting started, but still very well written.
Sad, frustrating, unjust, manipulative.......

Enzo’s 🐕 story centers on him and Denny, his owner and a race car 🏎 driver, when his seemingly happy life tragically changes and will face many lows, while awaiting the day he will be reborn as a human. The story truly is full of heartbreak and emotion, but what caught me more was Enzo’s point of view. It was more different than Bailey’s POV in the “Dog’s Purpose”, for his was more curious and positive. Enzo ‘s storytelling has a very serious and intelligent tone to it. While it has somewhat of a realistic feel, it doesn’t stop this story from being a great one about a man and his dog. A- (91%/Excellent)

“The Art of Racing in the Rain” is not your average dog book. I picked it up expecting a light easy read about a family pet and the adventures that ensue, much like “Marley and Me”, but this book could not be more different. The story is told from the point of view of Enzo the family pet. Enzo believes in karma and souls being reborn. Enzo believes after a soul lives long enough it is reborn as a human soul, and his soul is ready to be human. The one thing Enzo loves more than anything is race car driving. He developed this love from his owner Denny who is a semi-professional driver. Enzo uses the knowledge he gains from racing and the world around him to analyze life from the sidelines. He poses ideas on how to live life, and what matters in it. At the beginning of the book Enzo’s owner Denny marries Eve, and the two have a daughter named Zoe. The family goes through their everyday life which we experience from Enzo’s point of view. We experience Zoe’s first day of school, Denny race car career, and Eve’ struggle to raise a family. Everything for the family seems to be going fine, until midway through the book.The change will affect both the lives of Enzo and his family. Enzo sticks by Denny’s side and together they work through what they are up again
oh, I cried

Nakon što sam pročitala ovu knjigu otišla sam zagrliti svog psa i duugo ju nisam puštala iz zagrljaja. Ova knjiga je toliko topla i pozitivna, sjajno osvježenje u moru bezličnih i ne baš maštovitih novih knjiga koje sam čitala. Enzo, pas koji je pripovjedač u ovoj knjizi osvojit će vas na prvu (mene svakako je) i još dugo ćete ga se sjećati, kao i ostalih likova , jer oni su obični i svakodnevni ljudi koji se trude uspjeti u životu . Uz Enza i njegova vlasnika smijat ćete se, uživati u njihovoj sreći ali isto tako i plakati kad im se dogodi nepravda. Kad jednom krenete čitati ovu knjigu, teško da ćete moći stati sve dok ju i ne dovršite, a priča, jednostavno pisana, sama će vas pozivati da idete dalje i da vidite svijet nekim drugim(psećim) očima Na kraju, mislim da svatko od nas želi otkriti ovo umijeće, jer u životu nam se često događa da pada kiša, a mi ne znamo kako se nositi s tim. Moja topla preporuka :))

U cilju raščišćavanja svoje biblioteke već neko vreme uzimam random naslove koje sam davno čitala i čije se radnje ne sećam baš najjasnije i onda ih čitam ponovo ne bih li odlučila da li "lete" ili ostaju. Bila sam ubeđena da će ova knjiga da "leti", ali "neće ona niđe". Koliko je zapravo genijalno osmišljena i sprovedena u delo ova priča i baš mi je legla u ovom trenutku. Moram da pogledam i film mada nemam predstavu kako bi ovakva priča mogla da se prenese na ekran. "...nema svrhe ljutiti se na drugog vozača zbog nesrećnog slučaja. Moraš da pratiš vozače oko sebe, shvatiš njihove mogućnosti, samopuzdanje, nivo agresivnosti i uskladiš vožnju prema tome. Moraš znati ko vozi do tebe. Ako dođe do nekih poteškoća, na kraju si ih sam izazvao zato što si odgovoran za to gde se nalaziš i šta tamo radiš." "Vozač mora da prihvati svoju sudbinu. Mora da prihvati da je napravio greške. Pogrešne procene. Loše odluke. Skup okolnosti ga je doveo u takav položaj. Vozač sve to mora da prihvati i pripremi se da za to plati cenu. Mora da siđe sa staze. Da odbaci dva točka. Čak i četiri. Oseća se užasno, i kao vozač i kao takmičar. Šljunak mu udara o stajni trap. Oseća se kao da pliva u blatu. Dok su mu točkovi van staze drugi vozači ga pretiču. Zauzimaju njegovo mesto, nastavljaju da ubrzavaju. Samo on usporava. U tom trenutku, vozač oseća strahovitu krizu. Mora da doda gas. Mora da se vrati na stazu. Oh! Ludosti! Pomislite samo na vozače koji su izbačeni iz trke zato što su naglo okretali volane, preterano ispravljali vozila i okretali automobile ispred svojih takmaca. Ne daj bože naći se u takvom položaju... Pobednik, šampion, prihvata svoju sudbinu. On će se zajuriti točkovima u blato. Učiniće sve da zadrži pravac i postepeno će se vratiti na stazu kada bude bezbedno. Da, pašće za nekoliko mesta u trci. Da, izgubiće prednost. Ali ostaće u trci. I dalje je živ. Trka je dugačka. Bolje je voziti u okviru mogućnosti i završiti trku iza ostalih nego preterivati i slupati se."

“The Art of Racing in the Rain” by Garth Stein is told from the point of view of Enzo a dog of indeterminate heritage who longs for opposable thumbs. It is his memoirs of auto racing, life and love with his human companion Denny. I’m not a big car racing fan and sometimes books with animals talking are too, too precious. Not this one. I alternately laughed out loud, blubbered so hard I couldn’t see the words on the page and the most ugly part was when I wanted to find a couple of "evil twins" to smack because I got so annoyed with the “villains” of the story. In short, I give it two paws up!

Am început să citesc „Arta de a goni prin ploaie” de Garth Stein pentru că m-a atras metafora din titlu și am fost curioasă să aflu ce secrete ni se vor dezvălui astfel încât să învățăm, la rândul nostru, cum să gonim prin ploile din viețile noastre, cum să lăsăm norii de furtună în spate și să continuăm să înaintăm pe calea ce ne-a fost trasată. Nu am fost dezamăgită, am găsit multe astfel de sfaturi, însă romanul este mult mai mult decât atât, are atât de multă poezie în interior și o filosofie pură cu privire la viață și la moarte, încât m-a cutremurat total pe interior. Am început cartea gândindu-mă la poezia din titlu și am terminat-o câteva ore mai târziu cu lacrimi în ochi și cu inima sfâșiată în mii și mii de bucăți. „Arta de a goni prin ploaie” este o poveste emoționantă, care aduce în prim-plan bătăile ce trebuie purtate de oameni de-a lungul existenței lor pe acest Pământ. Cartea este una atipică, pentru că perspectiva narativă nu este cea a unei ființe umane, ci este una câinească, a unui labrador îndrăgostit de familia în care a poposit și de viața umană, pe care o analizează până la cele mai mici detalii. El arată că viața este minunată, indiferent de luptele pe care le avem de purtat, că important este să preluăm lecțiile din spatele oricăror greutăți și să mergem mai departe cu capul sus: „Tuturor ni se dă existența noastră fizică pentru a învăța ceva despre noi înșine.” În plus, autorul ne arată că stă doar în puterea noastră să ne conturăm existența, să ne construim un univers de care să fim mulțumiți și care să ne bucure sufletele. Asemeni șoferilor de la o cursă de mașini, și oamenii au puterea de a își creiona viața, căci sunt singurii responsabili de succesele și eșecurile lor. Un fel de mantră, un laitmotiv al întregii cărți este acela al „mașinii care merge încotro ți se îndreaptă privirea”, sugerând prin metaforă că avem puterea de a ne croi binele și răul din viețile noastre, că putem să atragem asupra noastră norocul sau ghinionul, care apoi se înlănțuie la nesfârșit. Autorul spune că ne definește ceea ce gândim și că gândul ajunge să ne controleze mai apoi acțiunile, pentru că orice energie am elibera în lume se întoarce la noi sub o formă sau alta. Tocmai de aceea, trebuie să ne păstrăm întotdeauna optimismul, indiferent de situațiile pe care le avem de înfruntat, să observăm mereu frumusețea vieții și să ne păstrăm încrederea în propriile forțe: „Cred că energia pe care fiecare dintre noi o eliberează în lume ni se returnează. Deci, oamenii au vreodată controlul? La un nivel profund, da, îl avem. Aici se potrivește metafora condusului la curse. Nimeni în afară de noi nu este responsabil pentru succesele și eșecurile noastre.” https://sufletsicrampeie.blogspot.com...
A bit sentimental, I still liked this book. It was simplistic but sweet.

Pročitala sam dvije od trinaest priča i krenula na treću s najboljom namjerom da dovršim ovu knjigu i dam joj priliku, ali nije išlo. Jednostavno mi nije sjela, dosadni likovi, već odavno pročitane priče ponovo prožvakane. Uvijek očekujem puno od knjiga koje su osvojile Pulitzerovu nagradu, možda je u tome stvar.

Dwa z plusem, ale jednak dwa. Gdyby ta książka była słabiej oceniana, dałbym jej 3 żeby pokazać, że mi "podobała się mniej niż reszcie", a że jest oceniana wysoko, to chciałbym, aby moja ocena kontrastowała z resztą pochwał. Mam nadzieję, że rozumiecie, co mam na myśli. W punktach ta notka przekaże najwięcej moich odczuć: + POMYSŁ, czyli to co angażuje czytelnika……… przez pierwsze 100 stron + kilka trafnych żartów :))))) ALE - bohater jest TAK nierealny, że aż boli - humor jako sposób radzenia sobie z tym, że ZOSTAWILI CIĘ NA MARSIE? FAJNIE, szkoda że nawet przez chwilę nie współczułem Watneyowi, z resztą jest to niemożliwe, kiedy nie ma on nawet jednego momentu poważniejszego załamania - czy bohater nie powinien bardziej odczuć skutków ogrzewania się RTG?! jeśli wiecie, co mam na myśli - no i kulminacja mojego wywodu: DLACZEGO TO JEST TAKIE LINIOWE I PRZEWIDYWALNE OD PIERWSZEJ STRONY? Jeszcze jedno: sądzę, że książka ta może zanudzić umysły humanistyczne swoją "technicznością", a nerdo-mat-fizów (#ja) zirytować formą opisów zjawisk fizycznych. Czyli książka dla nikogo. Ale!!!! Jeżeli komuś się podoba - to super! Też bym tak chciał. Wtedy nie męczyłbym się tak bardzo przy lekturze tej książki.

The Martian je prije svega propuštena prilika. Priča o astronautu koji je ostavljen sam na Marsu je trebala biti o otuđenosti, o tome kako je čovjek društvena životinja i kako ne može dugo izdržati bez kontakta s drugim ljudima. Pogotovu na drugom planetu! Trebao je to biti prikazak poniranja u ludilo koji se mogao dobro prikazati i kroz te dnevničke zapise koji su trebali biti sve manje koherentni i razumljivi, dok na kraju ne bi pisao besmislice. Priča bi puno bolje funkcionirala da je barem tri puta kraća, ili još bolje u obliku kratke priče i ispričana isključivo kroz te dnevničke zapise, tako da uranjanje u glavu glavnog lika bude potpuno. Mark Watney je iznenađujuće dobro realiziran lik za knjigu inače potpuno lišenu ikakvih emocija. Odnosno već od prvih par stranica sam povjerovao da je Mark Watney stvaran, i kako rekoh šteta što to autor nije iskoristio. Do kraja knjige Mark hladnokrvno izvještava o svim nedaćama koje su ga zadesile* i na kraju knjige je to opet onaj isti Mark, kao da se ništa nije desilo, kao da je prošao samo jedan beznačajan dan bez događanja, a ne više od godinu dana samoće u svakodnevnom strahu od smrti. Veći dio knjige je potrošen na pedantno opisivanje svake sitnice što glavni lik radi i kako funkcionira svaki uređaj koji je koristio, inače čitam hard sf i to mi je omiljeni podžanr sf-a i nije mi problem kada naprimjer Greg Egan na desetke stranica zabrazdi detaljno u kvantnu mehaniku pa provedem koji sat online istraživajući u pokušaju da shvatim opisano, ali on pokušava odvesti neke današnje pretpostavke i predviđanja dalje, kao što bi i trebao svaki dobar hard sf, dok Andy Weir ovdje doslovno izračunava koliko rupa glavni lik treba probušiti i kojim promjerom bušilice i onda opisuje postupak bušenje rupa - čudi me jedino što uz knjigu nisu priloženi i shematski prikazi prepravki koje je glavni lik napravio na raznim uređajima! To ja ne računam pod hard sf. * - a bilo ih je! Andy Weir je kod pripremanja za pisanje knjige osim raznih NASA-nih tehničkih priručnika (ali ne i onih o struji ;-) i priručnika o ekološkom uzgoju povrća, očito pročitao i knjižicu sa Murphyjevim zakonima, jer sve što je moglo krenuti krivo - krenulo je krivo. *UPDATE* Dobio sam odobrenje da objavim sljedeće dnevničke zapise koje je kolega napisao u stilu Marsovca opisujući dio svog dana :-) 16:45 -- spreman sam da idem kući, ali čekam kolegu iz radionice da mu dam neki okov 17:25 -- zadržao sam se duže jer je kolega kasnio, pa onda dok mi je objasnio kako da postavim kuglični klizače za ladice na kuhinji umjesto običnih... 17:35 -- svratio sam u prodavnicu da kupim pivo i druge namirnice 17:50 -- stigao sam kući i odmah sam pustio kera s lanca da se što duže igra dok je dan. 18:10 -- jeo sam, sada idem da postavim klizače na kuhinju 18:50 -- baš sam se namučio oko ovih klizača. tj. jednog para klizača za jednu ladicu. prvo sam morao da skinem postojeće. odšarafio sam dijelove sa kuh. elementa, i dijelove na ladici. dijelovi na ladici su bili pričvrćeni odozdo tako da su držali pod od ladice, pa kada sam ih skinuo morao sam da ponovo zavrnem šarafe da bi držali podnicu i morao sam bušiti rupe sa strane ladice za nove klizače. postojeće rupe u elementu ću iskoristiti jer njihov razmak taman odgovara razmaku na novim klizačima (logično, sve je to u standardu). teži dio je bio izmjeriti gdje trebaš zabušiti rupe na stranicama ladice tako da kada montiram klizač i kada stavim ladicu u element njena pozicija bude ista kao i sa starim klizačima. nisam bušio bušilicom nego šilom i čekićem -- tako mi je preciznije, a i svakako nemam onaj nastavak za bušilicu za zavrtanje šarafa. onda sam ručno zavrnu šarafe. jedva. po dva šarafa na svakoj stranici, probno, pa ako ladica bude stajala kako treba zavrnuću još po jedan da bolje učvrstim. kada sam stavio ladicu u element vidio sam da je tačno za jedan centimetar niže nego što je prije stajala, tako da sad smeta ladici ispod. jebemu mater! sad trebam pomjeriti dijelove na ladicama ili dijelove u elementu niže za 1cm. u svakom slučaju moram bušiti nove rupe, ali mi je lakše izbušiti na ladici koju mogu izvaditi nego sa unutrašnje strane elementa. ne da mi se sada to, posle ću... 19:00 -- uključio sam podcast i otvorio pivo 19:45 -- jako mi se prispavalo, hoću da padnem sa stolice. pauzirao sam podcast i svalio se na krevet. 22:30 -- probudio sam se. jebote, spavao sam 2 i po sata! 23:00 -- dovršio sam podcast i izlapilo pivo. 23:20 -- večerao sam i donio alat. 00:20 -- uspio sam popraviti ladicu. samo odvrnuo 4 šarafa, ponovo premjerio i zavrnuo nova nova 4 -- i opet mi je trebalo cijelih sat vremena! ja da radim u radionici u mojoj firmi bio bih beskoristan. zajebao sam se što sam prva dva šarafa koja sam odvrnuo sa ladice ponovo koristio za nove rupe; kako sam ih zavrtao, odvrtao i ponovo zavrtao totalno su se "izglodali", tako da sam morao manijački da uprem šarafcigerom da bih uspio malo da ga okrenem. milimetar po milimetar. jebemti, al' se ispatih! bole me ruke, prsti, dlanovi... btw. to su šarafi koje sam dobio uz klizače. ako su klizači takvog kvaliteta... jedva sam ušarafio ta dva. za drugu stranu ladice sam uzeo nova 2. ionako sam ih dobio više nego što mi treba, ali ja uvijek štedim šarafe -- kompulzivna potreba. kada sam stavio ladicu, savršeno je legla, tačno gdje treba. onda sam ušarafio dodatna 2 šarafa na ladice i 2 na korpus elementa. to je to. sutra kupujem još 3 para klizača i ponavljam proces 3 puta. mislim da će ići brže, ali svejedno će mi trebati bar sat i po. 00:50 -- dopisivao sam se sa bratićem. hoće da konvertira neke videe pa mi je tražio program koji sam ja koristio. morao sam ga uputiti kako da ga koristi. trebaju mu posebni codeci... 01:00 -- legao sam u krevet i uzeo knjigu. toliko sam nažuljao ruke na šarafciger da me sad ćoškovi tableta bodu. :D 02:00 -- ne mogu više. odložio sam tablet i ugasio svjetlo.

The Martian, romanzo di “fantascienza” di Andy Weir, è una strepitosa sorpresa e dopo averlo letto non mi stupisce che, originariamente autopubblicato, sia uscita quest’anno una nuova edizione per un’importate casa editrice. Un libro ardito che poteva risultare noioso, è invece estremamente piacevole, divertente, scorrevole – pensate a un Robinson Crusoe su Marte, ricco di dettagli e spunti scientifici, ma condito con un’ironia e brio che un po’ ricordano Douglas Adams. La premessa è intrigante: un equipaggio di sei astronauti americani durante la terza missione su Marte, è costretto ad evacuare in emergenza a causa di una fortissima tempesta di vento e sabbia. Credendolo perso per sempre, essi involontariamente lasciano dietro Mark Watney, che in realtà ha subito solo un lieve incidente e quando si riprende, capisce di essere solo sul pianeta rosso e con poche probabilità di sopravvivere. Questo non lo fa affatto perdere d’animo e, grazie al suo spirito intraprendente, la sua ironia, le sue conoscenze tecniche (botaniche e meccaniche), si mette subito all’opera per escogitare un modo per rimanere in vita e riallacciare le comunicazioni con la Nasa. Egli affronta un ostacolo dopo l’altro, iniziando con la ferita che quasi lo ha ucciso. In qualità di botanico, architetta come coltivare cibo supplementare, creare l’acqua da ossigeno e idrogeno, un esperimento terribilmente pericoloso, riparare i pannelli solari per costruire un sistema di comunicazione con la Terra. La sua storia è raccontata attraverso vivaci, divertenti voci del registro di Watney e altre trascrizioni. I primi capitoli contengono un sacco di elementi scientifici e tecnici, il protagonista narra come si inventi mille soluzioni per sopravvivere: pensavo questo azzardo rendesse la lettura pesante e distante, invece è assolutamente vivace, accattivante, lo stile tiene incollati alle pagine. A un certo punto, un’attenta addetta al controllo delle immagini satellitari, capisce che su Marte c’è qualcosa di “strano” e così la Nasa si rende conto che Mark è ancora vivo. Inizia un’altra sezione del libro, nella quale oltre a vedere le imprese del nostro astronauta, assistiamo alle operazioni che puntano ad organizzare una nuova missione per salvarlo. Lo stile dell’autore, frizzante, eterogeneo, regala un libro gustoso, originale, denso di momenti di suspense e scorrevolissimo.
So so good! Now to see the film interpretation!

“I bought this on a drunken whim” is a sentence that has immediately preceded many a relationship breakup. Not this time, though. I purchased The Martian from Amazon after having read numerous glowing reviews of it on Goodreads and quite a few beers. I then polished it off on a train ride to… somewhere. I don't remember where, only that it probably wasn't Mars. I do remember that I was somewhat down in the dumps at the start of that train ride, and by the end of it I was not only chirpy but positively fired up to go do some science. This is a useful frame of mind for me, given that's my job. Rather than go into the many merits of Andy Weir's book I'll finish the review using the medium of Mars-based webcomics. Immediately before reading The Martian I was sad. Just like I am every time I finish reading this xkcd . By the end I was happy. Just like I am when I read this comic .

Admito no terminar el libro, solo me faltaron 40 páginas, pero me resultó insoportable. Lenta, predecible, capaz que si te gusta la moda te gustará. Me animé a leerla porque la película me divirtió, pero este libro es una kgada infumable.
